text: August 4, 2010: Weekly Washington Update
label: HH2

text: August 04, 2010
label: BODY

text: This past week, we received good news about jobs in our area, and I voted on important
label: BODY

text: legislation supporting our military and veterans.
label: BODY

text: On Thursday, the Air Force announced that Langley Air Force Base (LAFB) will receive six
label: BODY

text: additional F-22s resulting in over 100 additional jobs at the base. I have worked closely with the
label: BODY

text: Air Force on this issue for over two years, and have spoken to Air Force Secretary Michael
label: BODY

text: Donley on a number of occasions regarding Langley and its strong position for growth
label: BODY

text: opportunities.  It’s great news for Langley, and a strong boost in jobs for our area.
label: BODY

text: Two key pieces of legislation for our troops and veterans passed the House last week with my
label: BODY

text: support. The Supplemental Appropriations Act of 2010, to cover combat operations, U.S.
label: BODY

text: disaster assistance, Haiti relief and reconstruction, and benefits for Vietnam veterans, finally
label: BODY

text: passed on Tuesday. In June, the House voted on an $81 billion version of the bill, which
label: BODY

text: contained $33 billion for the Department of Defense to conduct ongoing war operations, and
label: BODY

text: also billions in unrelated domestic spending.  It’s unfortunate that for weeks, this particular bill
label: BODY

text: supporting our brave men and women in uniform was delayed because of political attempts to
label: BODY

text: add on unrelated domestic spending measures. Our troops deserve our unwavering support. It
label: BODY

text: was essential that the House pass this legislation to support our men and women and uniform,
label: BODY

text: and I’m glad we were able to complete the bill to give our troops the funding they need to
label: BODY

text: accomplish their critical missions to keep our nation safe.
label: BODY

text: The annual spending measure supporting military construction and veterans’ affairs also passed
label: BODY

text: the House with overwhelming support. Here at home, America’s First District has a rich heritage
label: BODY

text: of military service and dedication to the defense of our nation, and one of the top priorities in my
label: BODY

text: work as your representative is to support our active military men and women, veterans, and
label: BODY

text: their families. This measure goes well beyond simply funding war efforts by providing resources
label: BODY

text: here at home to support our heroes with the benefits they have earned and deserve. This bill
label: BODY

text: provides the support and structure to maintain adequate housing, and support veterans’
label: BODY

text: education, health care and other services.  Overall, this legislation provides funding for military
label: BODY

text: construction projects and improvements. It also provides for the planning and design of a variety
label: BODY

text: of military facilities including operations, training, barracks, and medical care. Additionally, it
label: BODY

text: funds Department of Veterans Affairs programs, including compensation for veterans and
label: BODY

text: survivors, pension payments for disabled veterans, widows and children, housing credits,
label: BODY

text: training and tuition assistance, and veterans’ medical care and treatment.  Another critical
label: BODY

text: element of funding in this bill provides for the GI Education Benefits program and for Arlington
label: BODY

text: National Cemetery.
label: BODY

text: August 4, 2010: Weekly Washington Update
label: HH2

text: August 04, 2010
label: BODY

text: As August begins, I am excited at the opportunities this month will allow for me to speak with
label: BODY

text: you directly. I look forward to the many events, town halls, and meetings with many of you and I
label: BODY

text: hope we have a chance to meet as we travel around America’s First District. For frequent
label: BODY

text: updates of my work, be sure to follow me on Twitter  and Facebook .
label: BODY

text: Congressman Rob Wittman represents the First District of Virginia. He serves on the Natural
label: BODY

text: Resources Committee and the Armed Services Committee where he is the Ranking Member of
label: BODY

text: the Oversight and Investigations Subcommittee.
label: BODY
